name: describe_table
description: Retrieves detailed information for a specific table. This includes the table, dataset, and project identifiers; creation, last modification, and optional expiration timestamps; its type (e.g., 'TABLE', 'VIEW'); and optional row count and size in bytes. It also provides a detailed schema definition, listing all fields (columns) with their names, data types, modes, and any nested fields for structured (RECORD) types.

table_name.description: The name of the table for which to retrieve schema information. This string must be a fully qualified table name (e.g., `project_id.dataset_id.table_id`) that conforms to BigQuery naming conventions.

name: execute_query
description: Execute a SELECT query on the BigQuery database. Only SELECT queries are supported, and the query must reference tables using their fully qualified `project.dataset.table` name.

query.description: The SQL query to execute. This must be a `SELECT` statement and include a fully qualified table name in `project.dataset.table` format within its `FROM` clause.

name: list_tables
description: Lists all tables in the BigQuery database. It returns a list of dictionaries, where each dictionary represents a table and specifies its `table_id`, `dataset_id`, `project_id`, `type` (e.g., 'TABLE', 'VIEW', 'MATERIALIZED_VIEW'), creation time (Unix timestamp in milliseconds), and an optional expiration time (Unix timestamp in milliseconds).
